BOLINGBROOK HS TEACHER DEVELOPS "3-MONITOR" REMOTE CLASSROOM SETUP- Remote learning is leading VVSD teachers to create innovative ways to best serve their students. This fall, we‚Äôll be taking you on visits to a variety of classrooms throughout the District to show you how teachers are adapting their methods of instruction to meet the needs of their students who are learning from home.

Watch the video to visit the Advanced Placement Economics class of Bolingbrook HS Social Studies Teacher Mr. Michael Rende. Proving he‚Äôs a lifelong learner, Mr. Rende has developed a classroom setup with three monitor screens. The largest contains the Zoom window of his students, a second screen is where he manages the curriculum materials, and the third is where he can see the chat window so that he can always see current questions and feedback from students.

Teachers throughout VVSD are learning, evaluating, adapting, and yes, sometimes even rejecting, systems and methods as they refine remote learning to best meet the needs of students.

VVSD ELIMINATES CONCERN OVER CLEANING PRODUCTS SHORTAGE WITH PATHOSANS SYSTEM-
Among the concerns during the COVID-19 pandemic is shortages of cleaning supplies for public buildings. VVSD is being proactive in preventing such shortages with the help of cleaning services contractor GSF-USA.

Throughout all VVSD school buildings, GSF-USA is using the PathoSans System which generates cleaning products on-site thereby eliminating concerns about shortages. In addition, PathoSans cleaning products reliably kill 99.999% of bacteria without exposing workers to harsh chemicals and also eliminates the need for multiple cleaning solutions for various surfaces.

Watch the video at
https://youtu.be/DBFZjFf8y_Q

to learn how VVSD benefits from the PathoSans System and how the cleaning products generated by the system are friendlier to students, staff, and the surfaces in our school buildings. #VVSDProud #EveryLearner365

JENNIFER DUFFY NAMED PRINCIPAL AT OAK VIEW ELEMENTARY SCHOOL- The VVSD Board of Education has approved the selection of Mrs. Jennifer Duffy to the position of Principal at Oak View Elementary School. Mrs. Duffy will succeed Mr. Robert Pinciak on July 1, 2020. Mr. Pinciak is moving to the Principal position at Pioneer Elementary School at the end of the current school year.

Mrs. Duffy is currently the Asst. Principal at R.C. Hill Elementary School and has served in that role since 2018. She began her service in VVSD in 2005 as a 5th grade teacher at Wood View Elementary School. Mrs. Duffy holds a Bachelor of Science Degree from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign in Human Development and Family Studies. She continued her education by earning a Master of Education in Instructional Leadership/Elementary Education from the University of Illinois at Chicago. Ms. Duffy earned her second master‚Äôs degree in Instructional Leadership/Education from Concordia University.

JENNIFER DUFFY NAMED PRINCIPAL AT OAK VIEW ELEMENTARY SCHOOL- The VVSD Board of Education has approved the selection of Mrs. Jennifer Duffy to the position of Principal at Oak View Elementary School. Mrs. Duffy will succeed Mr. Robert Pinciak on July 1, 2020. Mr. Pinciak is moving to the Principal position at Pioneer Elementary School at the end of the current school year.

She began her service in VVSD in 2005 as a 5th grade teacher at Wood View Elementary School. Mrs. Duffy holds a Bachelor of Science Degree from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign in Human Development and Family Studies. She continued her education by earning a Master of Education in Instructional Leadership/Elementary Education from the University of Illinois at Chicago. Ms. Duffy earned her second master‚Äôs degree in Instructional Leadership/Education from Concordia University.

Ryan will be attending the University of South Florida in the fall and is going to study music education. He is among 2500 winners of this specific award nationwide.

Over 1.5 million juniors in about 21,000 high schools entered the 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program by taking the 2018 Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test (PSAT/NMSQT¬Æ), which served as an initial screen of program entrants. The nationwide pool of finalists, representing less than one percent of U.S. high school seniors, includes the highest-scoring entrants in each state.

The National Merit Scholarship Competition awards over $31 million in scholarships annually to college bound high school seniors.

A special thank you to the VVSD high school students, staff members, and representatives of Argonne National Laboratory, Citgo and ComEd who volunteered to run STEMCathlon.

Watch the video to see the development process in the Rocket Build competition and the test phase of the Kick Stick Build. #vvsdproud

First, they learned they are one of just 73 U.S. schools named a 2019 National ESEA (Elementary and Secondary Education Act) Distinguished School for the extraordinary success of their students. Then they received a congratulatory visit from Illinois Congressman Bill Foster.

Rep. Foster explained to students there are approximately 100,000 schools in the United States and only 73 received the ESEA designation. To put that in context, he asked the students to picture in their minds a big football stadium with 100,000 people inside, and then, picture the marching band on the field at halftime. Rep. Foster said the marching band represents the proportion of the number of people in the stadium that parallels the proportion of schools that have earned this honor.

Watch the video to see and hear Rep. Foster share with students the proclamation he will be reading into the Congressional Record about Salk Elementary School. #vvsdproud

Every year for a 9/11 student service project, Mrs. King leads Lukancic students to raise money for care packages and then assists them in writing letters to soldiers deployed overseas.

This year, the students raised about $135 to purchase items for the care packages and then, with the help of Operation Support Our Troops, sent the packages with the letters all over the world. Just before the Holidays, replies from some of the soldiers made their way back to Lukancic. Watch the video to hear Lukancic students read the letters they received from the brave men and women who serve our country. #vvsdproud
